text: {{Infobox settlement | name = ǁKaras Region | native_name = | native_name_lang = | settlement_type = Region | image_skyline = | image_caption = | image_flag = | image_seal = | image_shield = | image_map = ǁKaras in Namibia.svg | map_caption = Location of the ǁKaras Region in Namibia | pushpin_map = | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Namibia | established_title = | established_date = | seat_type = Capital | seat = Keetmanshoop | leader_party = | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 161,514 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 77421 | population_as_of = 2011 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = South African Standard Time: UTC+2 | utc_offset1 = | timezone1_DST = | utc_offset1_DST = | postal_code_type = | postal_code = | area_code_type = | area_code = | website = }} ǁKaras is a region in Namibia. The capital is Keetmanshoop. It was originally called "Karas Region" until the name was changed in August 2013 to include the "ǁ" symbol.https://allafrica.com/stories/201308090372.html Aletta Fredericks became Governor in 2020. The Karas mountain range is in the southern part. Fish River Canyon is also in the region. There are 7 constituencies: * Berseba * Karasburg East * Keetmanshoop Rural * Keetmanshoop Urban * ǃNamiǂNûs (formerly Lüderitz Constituency) * Oranjemund * Karasburg West == References == Category:Regions of Namibia
title: ǁKaras Region
